Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of New Zealanders learning Islamic ablution by presenting a video of a Friday prayer and solidarity event as evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that New Zealanders are flocking to learn Islamic ablution.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video of the Friday prayer event represents New Zealanders learning Islamic ablution, when in fact it was a show of solidarity after a mosque shooting.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the video, which is that it shows a Friday prayer and solidarity event rather than New Zealanders learning Islamic ablution.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video corresponds to news reports about a Friday prayer and solidarity event, rather than New Zealanders learning Islamic ablution.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in this claim.
